intro: Agapetes pentastigma, commonly known as the five-stigma heather, is a species of flowering plant in the Ericaceae family. It is native to the Andean regions of South America, particularly in Ecuador and Peru. The plant is a compact shrub with small, leathery leaves and produces clusters of bell-shaped flowers in shades of white and pink. It thrives in cool, humid environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
